refnamediv.refpurpose: This function performs Single Side Band Amplitude Demodulation

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: Z = ssbdemod(Y,Fc,Fs) Z = ssbdemod(Y,Fc,Fs,INI_PHASE) Z = ssbdemod(Y,Fc,Fs,INI_PHASE,NUM,DEN)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Z = ssbdemod(Y,Fc,Fs) demodulates the single sideband amplitude modulated signal Y with the carrier frequency Fc (Hz). Sample frequency Fs (Hz). zero initial phase (ini_phase). The modulated signal can be an upper or lower sideband signal. A lowpass butterworth filter is used in the demodulation.
Z = ssbdemod(Y,Fc,Fs,INI_PHASE) adds an extra argument the initial phase (rad) of the modulated signal.
Z = ssbdemod(Y,Fc,Fs,INI_PHASE,NUM,DEN) adds extra arguments about the filter specifications i.e., the numerator and denominator of the lowpass filter.
Fs must satisfy Fs >2*(Fc + BW), where BW is the bandwidth of the modulating signal.
